required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Validity and Reliability of a Low-cost Chair Dynamometer
clinical_study.official_title: Validity and Reliability of a Low-cost Chair Dynamometer

lead_sponsor.agency: Spinal Cord Injury Centre of Western Denmark

clinical_study.source: Spinal Cord Injury Centre of Western Denmark

brief_summary.textblock:
In part 1 of the study, fourteen able-bodied individuals will undergo maximal, voluntary contraction (MVC) test of the lower limbs in two dynamometers. One being a low-cost dynamometer (S2P-CD), and the other being a gold standard dynamometer (HUMAC). Thereby we will be able to assess the validity of the S2P-CD.
In part 2 of the study, eighteen persons with spinal cord injury will undergo MVC twice in the S2P-CD. Thereby we will be able to assess the reliability of the measurements of the S2P-CD.

detailed_description.textblock:
In part 1 of the study, fourteen able-bodied individuals will undergo maximal, voluntary contraction (MVC) test of the lower limbs in two dynamometers. One being a low-cost dynamometer (S2P-CD), and the other being a gold standard dynamometer (HUMAC). The tests will be carried out with 72-96 hours between them. Thereby we will be able to assess the validity of the S2P-CD.
In part 2 of the study, eighteen persons with spinal cord injury will undergo MVC twice in the S2P-CD. They will be recruited through the Spinal Cord Injury Centre of Western Denmark (SCIWDK). The test will be carried out with 30min between them. Thereby we will be able to assess the reliability of the measurements of the S2P-CD.

intervention.description: A test for maximal muscle strength and explosive power in the lower limbs

study_pop.textblock:
Ablebodied, healthy volunteers
Spinal cord injured individuals admitted at SCIWDK

criteria.textblock:
Ablebodied individuals:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age >18 y
Exclusion Criteria:
- Orthopedic or other injuries that may limit maximal muscle strength
Spinal cord injured individuals:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age > 18 y
- Congenital or acquired spinal cord injury with some degree of preserved muscle function in the lower limbs
Exclusion Criteria:
- Orthopedic or other injuries that may limit maximal muscle strength
- Significant competing diseases
- Severe osteoperosis

facility.name: Spinal Cord Injury Centre of Western Denmark

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Spinal Cord Injury Centre of Western Denmark
